meanings.definition: The edible starchy tuberous root of a tropical plant, used as a staple food in tropical countries.
meanings.sent1: In some tropical countries, people rely on mandiocas as a main source of food.
meanings.sent2: Farmers harvest mandiocas to feed their families and communities.
meanings.sent3: The mandiocas at the market were so big, they looked like giant carrots!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as comforting as a warm bowl of mandiocas on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly cooked mandiocas filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.

meanings.definition: A tropical plant with large leaves and tuberous roots, cultivated for its edible starchy roots.
meanings.sent1: The mandiocas plant requires a lot of sunlight to grow healthily.
meanings.sent2: Farmers take great care of their mandiocas plants to ensure a good harvest.
meanings.sent3: The mandiocas plant in the garden seemed to wave at me in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back like the leaves of a mandiocas plant.
meanings.sent5: The mandiocas plant stood tall and proud in the field, ready to provide nourishment.
